item.title: Overgrown hedge Auburn House fench, 25th July
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I would be grateful if you could cut the overgrown hedge at Auburn House fence spilling out to the pavement. Thank you

item.title: Road Works completed but barriers till remain, 25th July
item.description:
Recent drain works have been completed a few days ago and rest of the road has had barriers removed but there is one location at 93 Eaton Place (end of Eaton Place) that still remains after the work. Can the barriers be removed and Road Works signage outside 84 Eaton Place Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 25th July
item.description:
A Parcel Force delivery driver has wiped a black substance over a public lamp post situated on Bramley Close, Swanley, as shown in the photo and could be deemed as graffiti. Following communication with Parcel Force, they have acknowledged it was their driver who did it, as the allegation was supported by CCTV. They have said they will send someone to remove the substance but at the time of reporting this, no one has yet attended so the black substance remains at a height that anyone, including a child could touch. This might be something the council deals with.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bramley Close, High Firs, Swanley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A whole bed base., 25th July
item.description:
Please collect. I am so fed up of this happening right outside where I live. I am traumatized by this constant dumping where I pay my council tax and no one ever collects these fly tipping items which are now building up in the alleyway. .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colville Road, Edmonton, London

item.title: Seeds, bottles, cans, 25th July
item.description:
Photo of this report On one side strewn litter and seeds husks everywhere. Litter all down the street. On the other side dumped bin bags whose rubbish is now going all over the street. It’s disgusting and unhygienic. We should not have to live in such conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
